trans-unit.source: This topic and its sub-topics provides the JSON format that is supported by the older versions of Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This topic and its sub-topics provides the JSON format that is supported by the older versions of Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the July 2015 Release version of Azure PowerShell or later, see <link xlink:href="271962fb-81a8-4008-8b46-a6f497457078" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Datasets</link> for the latest JSON format.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the July 2015 Release version of Azure PowerShell or later, see <link xlink:href="271962fb-81a8-4008-8b46-a6f497457078" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Datasets</link> for the latest JSON format.

trans-unit.source: The Location Element is not supported in the new JSON format.
trans-unit.target: The Location Element is not supported in the new JSON format.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="88f04b09-891b-425b-9a4b-257bcc7e8fb4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">TypeProperties Element</link> that replaces the Location element.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="88f04b09-891b-425b-9a4b-257bcc7e8fb4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">TypeProperties Element</link> that replaces the Location element.

trans-unit.source: You can convert the JSON from old format to new format by using the tool: <externalLink><linkText>JSON Upgrade Tool</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=618507</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: You can convert the JSON from old format to new format by using the tool: <externalLink><linkText>JSON Upgrade Tool</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=618507</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> section in a JSON file that defines an Azure Data Factory table contains information on the format of the data and where to find the data.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> section in a JSON file that defines an Azure Data Factory table contains information on the format of the data and where to find the data.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the table type, different properties are supported in this section.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the table type, different properties are supported in this section.

trans-unit.source: The following sections provide details about properties that are supported for each type of location (listed below).
trans-unit.target: The following sections provide details about properties that are supported for each type of location (listed below).

trans-unit.source: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>AzureSqlTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>AzureSqlTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Name of the table in the Azure SQL Database instance that linked service refers to.
trans-unit.target: Name of the table in the Azure SQL Database instance that linked service refers to.

trans-unit.source: Name of the linked service that refers to an Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Name of the linked service that refers to an Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: This linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>AzureSqlLinkedService</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: This linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>AzureSqlLinkedService</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>AzureBlobLocation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>AzureBlobLocation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Path to the container and folder in the blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Path to the container and folder in the blob storage.

trans-unit.source: It is only applicable when you want to specify a certain blob file in the folderPath, instead of all blobs in it.
trans-unit.target: It is only applicable when you want to specify a certain blob file in the folderPath, instead of all blobs in it.

trans-unit.source: When the file name is not specified for an output table, the name of the generated file would following this format: Data.<Guid>.txt (for example: : Data.0a405f8a-93ff-4c6f-b3be-f69616f1df7a.txt.
trans-unit.target: When the file name is not specified for an output table, the name of the generated file would following this format: Data.<Guid>.txt (for example: : Data.0a405f8a-93ff-4c6f-b3be-f69616f1df7a.txt.

trans-unit.source: It is optional and only used to replace macros.
trans-unit.target: It is optional and only used to replace macros.

trans-unit.source: In the above example {Slice} is replaced with the value of Data Factory system variable SliceStart in the format (YYYYMMDDHH) specified.
trans-unit.target: In the above example {Slice} is replaced with the value of Data Factory system variable SliceStart in the format (YYYYMMDDHH) specified.

trans-unit.source: The SliceStart refers to start time of the slice.
trans-unit.target: The SliceStart refers to start time of the slice.

trans-unit.source: The folderPath is different for each slice.
trans-unit.target: The folderPath is different for each slice.

trans-unit.source: In the above example, year, month, day, and time of SliceStart are extracted into separate variables that are used by folderPath and fileName properties.
trans-unit.target: In the above example, year, month, day, and time of SliceStart are extracted into separate variables that are used by folderPath and fileName properties.

trans-unit.source: Name of the linked service that refers to an Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: Name of the linked service that refers to an Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: If the format is set to <embeddedLabel>TextFormat</embeddedLabel>, you can specify the following properties in the <embeddedLabel>Format</embeddedLabel> section within the <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> section.
trans-unit.target: If the format is set to <embeddedLabel>TextFormat</embeddedLabel>, you can specify the following properties in the <embeddedLabel>Format</embeddedLabel> section within the <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> section.

trans-unit.source: The character(s) used as a column separator in a file.This tag is optional.
trans-unit.target: The character(s) used as a column separator in a file.This tag is optional.

trans-unit.source: The character(s) used as a raw separator in file.
trans-unit.target: The character(s) used as a raw separator in file.

trans-unit.source: The default value is any of the following: [“\r\n”, “\r”,” \n”].
trans-unit.target: The default value is any of the following: [“\r\n”, “\r”,” \n”].

trans-unit.source: The special character used to escape column delimiter shown in content.
trans-unit.target: The special character used to escape column delimiter shown in content.

trans-unit.source: You must specify no more than one character for this property.
trans-unit.target: You must specify no more than one character for this property.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have comma (,) as the column delimiter but you want have comma character in the text (example: “Hello, world”), you can define ‘$’ as the escape character and use string “Hello$, world” in the source.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have comma (,) as the column delimiter but you want have comma character in the text (example: “Hello, world”), you can define ‘$’ as the escape character and use string “Hello$, world” in the source.

trans-unit.source: Note that you cannot specify both escapeChar and quoteChar for a table.
trans-unit.target: Note that you cannot specify both escapeChar and quoteChar for a table.

trans-unit.source: The special character is used to quote the string value.
trans-unit.target: The special character is used to quote the string value.

trans-unit.source: The column and row delimiters inside of the quote characters would be treated as part of the string value.
trans-unit.target: The column and row delimiters inside of the quote characters would be treated as part of the string value.

trans-unit.source: You must specify no more than one character for this property.
trans-unit.target: You must specify no more than one character for this property.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have comma (,) as the column delimiter but you want have comma character in the text (example: <Hello, world>), you can define ‘"’ as the quote character and use string <"Hello, world"> in the source.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have comma (,) as the column delimiter but you want have comma character in the text (example: <Hello, world>), you can define ‘"’ as the quote character and use string <"Hello, world"> in the source.

trans-unit.source: This property is applicable to both input and output tables.
trans-unit.target: This property is applicable to both input and output tables.

trans-unit.source: Note that you cannot specify both escapeChar and quoteChar for a table.
trans-unit.target: Note that you cannot specify both escapeChar and quoteChar for a table.

trans-unit.source: The character(s) used to represent null value in blob file content.
trans-unit.target: The character(s) used to represent null value in blob file content.

trans-unit.source: For example, based on above sample, “NaN” in blob will be translated as null value while copied into e.g. SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: For example, based on above sample, “NaN” in blob will be translated as null value while copied into e.g. SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: For the list of valid encoding names, see: <externalLink><linkText>Encoding.EncodingName Property</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.text.encoding(v=vs.110).aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For the list of valid encoding names, see: <externalLink><linkText>Encoding.EncodingName Property</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.text.encoding(v=vs.110).aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: If the format is set to <embeddedLabel>AvroFormat</embeddedLabel>, you do not need to specify any properties in the <embeddedLabel>Format</embeddedLabel> section within the <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> section.
trans-unit.target: If the format is set to <embeddedLabel>AvroFormat</embeddedLabel>, you do not need to specify any properties in the <embeddedLabel>Format</embeddedLabel> section within the <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> section.

trans-unit.source: To use Avro format in subsequent Hive table, you can refer to <externalLink><linkText>Apache Hive’s tutorial</linkText><linkUri>https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/AvroSerDe</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To use Avro format in subsequent Hive table, you can refer to <externalLink><linkText>Apache Hive’s tutorial</linkText><linkUri>https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/AvroSerDe</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, double-quotes (") is specified as the quote character.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, double-quotes (") is specified as the quote character.

trans-unit.source: To use an escapeChar instead of quoteChar, replace the line with quoteChar with the following:
trans-unit.target: To use an escapeChar instead of quoteChar, replace the line with quoteChar with the following:

trans-unit.source: If you specify type as <embeddedLabel>AzureTableLocation</embeddedLabel> , you need to specify the linked service that points to an Azure Storage, and name of the table (<embeddedLabel>tableName</embeddedLabel>).
trans-unit.target: If you specify type as <embeddedLabel>AzureTableLocation</embeddedLabel> , you need to specify the linked service that points to an Azure Storage, and name of the table (<embeddedLabel>tableName</embeddedLabel>).

trans-unit.source: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.
trans-unit.target: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.

trans-unit.source: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>AzureTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>AzureTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Name of the linked service that refers to the Azure Storage that contains the table.
trans-unit.target: Name of the linked service that refers to the Azure Storage that contains the table.

trans-unit.source: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>AzureStorageLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>AzureStorageLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: To define an Azure Data Factory table for an Azure DocumentDB collection, specify location properties as shown below:
trans-unit.target: To define an Azure Data Factory table for an Azure DocumentDB collection, specify location properties as shown below:

trans-unit.source: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.
trans-unit.target: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.

trans-unit.source: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>DocumentDbCollectionLocation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>DocumentDbCollectionLocation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Name of the DocumentDB document collection.
trans-unit.target: Name of the DocumentDB document collection.

trans-unit.source: Name of the linked service that refers to the Azure DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: Name of the linked service that refers to the Azure DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>DocumentDbLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>DocumentDbLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following example provides a table JSON with location <embeddedLabel>type</embeddedLabel> set to <embeddedLabel>DocumentDbCollectionLocation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The following example provides a table JSON with location <embeddedLabel>type</embeddedLabel> set to <embeddedLabel>DocumentDbCollectionLocation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.
trans-unit.target: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.

trans-unit.source: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesSqlServerTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesSqlServerTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Name of the table in the on-premises SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: Name of the table in the on-premises SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises SQL Server database that contains the table.
trans-unit.target: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises SQL Server database that contains the table.

trans-unit.source: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesSqlLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesSqlLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.
trans-unit.target: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.

trans-unit.source: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesOracleTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesOracleTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Name of the table in the on-premises Oracle database.
trans-unit.target: Name of the table in the on-premises Oracle database.

trans-unit.source: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises Oracle database that contains the table.
trans-unit.target: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises Oracle database that contains the table.

trans-unit.source: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesOracleLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesOracleLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Use escape character ‘ \ ’ for special characters in the string.
trans-unit.target: Use escape character ‘ \ ’ for special characters in the string.

trans-unit.source: For example: for folder\subfolder, specify folder\\subfolder and for d:\samplefolder, specify d:\\samplefolder.
trans-unit.target: For example: for folder\subfolder, specify folder\\subfolder and for d:\samplefolder, specify d:\\samplefolder.

trans-unit.source: You can combine this with <embeddedLabel>partitionBy</embeddedLabel> to have folder paths based on slice start/end date-times.
trans-unit.target: You can combine this with <embeddedLabel>partitionBy</embeddedLabel> to have folder paths based on slice start/end date-times.

trans-unit.source: Specify the name of the file in the <embeddedLabel>folderPath</embeddedLabel> if you want the table to refer to a specific file in the folder.
trans-unit.target: Specify the name of the file in the <embeddedLabel>folderPath</embeddedLabel> if you want the table to refer to a specific file in the folder.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify any value for this property, the table points to all files in the folder.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify any value for this property, the table points to all files in the folder.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>filename</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>fileFilter</embeddedLabel> cannot be used simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>filename</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>fileFilter</embeddedLabel> cannot be used simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, all files are used.
trans-unit.target: If not specified, all files are used.

trans-unit.source: See the description for <embeddedLabel>partitionBy</embeddedLabel> property in the <link xlink:href="5606aefb-b5d3-49f0-b108-2ab3d0652e77#AzureBlob" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Blob </link>.
trans-unit.target: See the description for <embeddedLabel>partitionBy</embeddedLabel> property in the <link xlink:href="5606aefb-b5d3-49f0-b108-2ab3d0652e77#AzureBlob" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Blob </link>.

trans-unit.source: Specify a filter to be used to select a subset of files in the <embeddedLabel>folderPath</embeddedLabel> rather than all files.
trans-unit.target: Specify a filter to be used to select a subset of files in the <embeddedLabel>folderPath</embeddedLabel> rather than all files.

trans-unit.source: Allowed values are: <embeddedLabel>*</embeddedLabel> (multiple characters) and <embeddedLabel>?</embeddedLabel> (single character).
trans-unit.target: Allowed values are: <embeddedLabel>*</embeddedLabel> (multiple characters) and <embeddedLabel>?</embeddedLabel> (single character).

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>filename</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>fileFilter</embeddedLabel> cannot be used simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>filename</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>fileFilter</embeddedLabel> cannot be used simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: Name of the linked service that is of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesFileSystemLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Name of the linked service that is of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesFileSystemLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="28d6c506-71a9-4c74-b1d8-be3688b1aa4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">On-Premises File System Linked Service</link> topic for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="28d6c506-71a9-4c74-b1d8-be3688b1aa4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">On-Premises File System Linked Service</link> topic for details.

trans-unit.source: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.
trans-unit.target: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.

trans-unit.source: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>RelationalTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>RelationalTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Name of the table in the on-premises MySQL database.
trans-unit.target: Name of the table in the on-premises MySQL database.

trans-unit.source: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises MySQL database that contains the table.
trans-unit.target: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises MySQL database that contains the table.

trans-unit.source: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesMySqlLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesMySqlLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.
trans-unit.target: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.

trans-unit.source: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>RelationalTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>RelationalTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Name of the table in the on-premises DB2 database.
trans-unit.target: Name of the table in the on-premises DB2 database.

trans-unit.source: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises DB2 database that contains the table.
trans-unit.target: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises DB2 database that contains the table.

trans-unit.source: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesDb2LinkedService</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesDb2LinkedService</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.
trans-unit.target: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.

trans-unit.source: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>RelationalTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>RelationalTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Name of the table in the on-premises Teradata database.
trans-unit.target: Name of the table in the on-premises Teradata database.

trans-unit.source: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises Teradata database that contains the table.
trans-unit.target: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises Teradata database that contains the table.

trans-unit.source: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesTeradataLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesTeradataLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.
trans-unit.target: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.

trans-unit.source: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>RelationalTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>RelationalTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Name of the table in the on-premises Sybase database.
trans-unit.target: Name of the table in the on-premises Sybase database.

trans-unit.source: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises Sybase database that contains the table.
trans-unit.target: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises Sybase database that contains the table.

trans-unit.source: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesSybaseLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesSybaseLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.
trans-unit.target: Type of the Azure Data Factory table.

trans-unit.source: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>RelationalTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type should be set to <embeddedLabel>RelationalTableLocation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Name of the table in the on-premises PostgreSQL database.
trans-unit.target: Name of the table in the on-premises PostgreSQL database.

trans-unit.source: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises PostgreSQL database that contains the table.
trans-unit.target: Name of the linked service that refers to an on-premises PostgreSQL database that contains the table.

trans-unit.source: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesPostgreSqlLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The linked service must be of type: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesPostgreSqlLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.
